author: {'steamid': '76561198057217695', 'num_games_owned': 3818, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1455130678}
review:
Удалось ознакомиться с очередной работой студии [b]Aldorlea Games[/b], поклонником которой я являюсь. На этот раз нам представили игру не в фэнтезийном сеттинге, а в современном а-ля Bare Knuckle. Враги не эльфы, гномы, гоблины и т.д., а панки, самураи, бандиты...

Сюжет прост и незатейлив: наш главный герой сильно влюблен в одну красавицу, но очень стесняется к ней подойти и пригласить на свидание. Однако когда он узнает, что ее похитили, бросает все и отправляется в погоню. Так и начинается наше приключение.

Сперва нам предлагают набрать себе команду из представленных персонажей, правда непонятно кто и что умеет, поэтому выбирать предстоит вслепую. После прохождений на уровне normal и выше нам откроют дополнительных героев, а при прохождении maniac обещают супер бонус.

 [i]Общий взгляд на игру:[/i]
+ Как всегда разработчики порадовали проработкой и внимательному отношению к деталям, на каждой локации множество мелочей, которые радуют глаза. Видно что практически не пользовались стандартными шаблонами [b]RPG Maker[/b], как это делают многие другие разработчики, за это огромный плюс.
+ Как всегда много статусов (больше 10), больше отрицательных, которые отражаются на статистике наших героев. Выучить их дело нелегкое, но если хотите пройти на режиме hard и выше, предстоит их доскональна изучить. К примеру, некоторые оружия заведомо слабее по общему урону, но обладают уникальными возможностями по изменению статуса противников, что порой гораздо важнее. 
+ Боссы зачастую не намного сильнее обычных противников, также их можно отравить, парализовать и т.д.
+ Очень порадовала сама рисовка.
+ Очень много ачивок, чтобы получить большинство из них нужно пройти игру не менее 2-3 раз. 
- Расстроило музыкальное сопровождение. Не знаю, может сам стиль не понравился, но доигрывал со своей музыкой.
- Некоторые шероховатости. К примеру, после применения некоторых предметов меня сразу выкидывало с инвентаря, а если мне надо его использовать два, а то и больше раз, то приходилось снова заходить. Мелочь, а неприятно.
- Большинство уровней, здесь миров, представляют из себя серию небольших комнатушек. Никакого подобия лабиринтов, скрытых проходов и т.д. Исключением является первый и последний уровень.

Если будете начинать играть, то советую взять группу рандомно (ачивка!) и поставить уровень normal.

[i]В целом хорошая работа [b]Aldorlea Games[/b], но как по мне, сильно уступающая серии [b]Millenium[/b] и [b]The Book of Legends[/b]. Прошел игру разок, позже думаю вернусь, чтобы открыть остальных персонажей. 

Всем удачи и не теряйте любимых![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198048270055', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1452866977}
review:
POSITIVES:

+ Absurd concept which throws you right into action (I'll go talk to my crush over ther- KIDNAPPED BY A NINJA)
+ Cheesy setting (let's say this lasts for the first 3 chapters out of 8)
+ Renaming your protagonist/girlfriend/party members. Allows some chuckles when you name them after friends or such.
+ I wanted to say "choices", but...

NEGATIVES:

- The *illusion* of choices. Game starts with asking for both your own and your crush's gender, seemingly allowing any combination. Straight/gay dude/chick? Technically you can choose whatever - but no matter what you pick, you will be playing a dude rescuing a girl.
Similarly, at the team-collecting stage you are asked if you want to go on the adventure alone - but when you pick the "yes" for that, you character goes "nah" and you are forced to gather a party anyway. This wouldn't be in negatives if these questions were never present, but the illusion of choice here is more disappointing than the lack of it would be.

- That cheesy setting from positives? Eventually goes stale when the game apparently gives up half-way and instead of being creative with enemies, it just keeps throwing more variants of Asian warriors at you and calls it a day.

- Lack of manual or a way to rebind keys. This results in having to go through trial-and-error to figure out all keys, some of which aren't the most obvious (like in party creation renaming your characters from the default name requires a backspace - which is bound to the Insert key of all things).
No manual means you'll also have a limited idea of how in-game stats work and affect your effectivity. This can be "fixed" with getting the paid guide dlc - which isn't exactly a thing one would give a Plus for.

- Annoying mechanics in the quality-of-life department.
Example 1) With hunger, game doesn't check when you last ate, but rather when you last stopped being hungry. This makes it common to heal a character with 3 pizzas, only to a few moments later hear him say "I'm hungry bro, got any pizza?"
Example 2) Red toros are a +50exp consumable. You find dozens and hundreds of them, but can only consume one at a time, each requiring the "worldmap -> menu -> items -> ok -> scroll down to toro -> pick toro -> pick party member -> ok -> automatic return to worldmap" sequence.

- Questionable difficulty, aka the reason I gave up and dropped the game. The game saves every 5 fights, and my party is currectly encountering ninjas in packs of few per fight. Each ninja takes 1-2 rounds to be taken down, and each can one-hit kill a party member if he feels like it. All that despite having my party members using best weapons and armor I could find and buy, actively trying to play the game in a smart way, and all this on "easy mode" (!) at that.

review:
Recently finished, so here's my 2 cents:

Girlfriend Rescue is your standard issue RPG Maker game, both developed and published by Aldorlea Games (notorious developer of many RPG Maker games). Its a JRPG that handles similar to old school Dragon Warrior or Final Fantasy, but with a bit more room for strategy in both building your party and combat. The story itself takes place in a modern, urban setting which is a breath of fresh air (ironically) as opposed to your typical medieval fantasies. There's an interesting variety of characters to construct your party with, to which you will use to trudge through the 8 different scenarios. Explore a bit, loot things, fight baddies, and continue onwards. At the end of each scenario you get a little piece of story that serves as a reminder in case you forgot what the game was all about (see: title), and then you go back to walking and mashing the X button.

Its not the most fun I've had with one of these kinds of games, in fact I'm a bit disappointed in Aldorlea Games. After playing Deadly Sin 2 and Skyborn, I really expected more from this title. I only recommend it if you have absolutely no other RPGs to play.. or just really need that old school RPG fix, even then wait for a sale.

Pros:

+ Interesting variety of characters
+ Fresh, urban setting
+ Fast paced combat
+ Colorful visuals

Cons:

- Mediocre story
- Poorly written dialogue
- Repetitive battles
- Ugly enemy artwork
- Vague character/skill descriptions
- Messed up controls with my X360 gamepad
- Lack of settings (volume, controls, etc)

5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197960342736', 'num_games_owned': 1601, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1497721617}
review:
Le concept est particulièrement fun : un scénar digne des meilleurs nanards des années 80 où on doit aller bastonner des méchants pour sauver sa belle enlevée, mais la réalisation et le gameplay ne suivent pas du tout.

Niveau réalisation déjà c'est du RPG Maker très bas de gamme. Il y a de trop rares artworks pour l'intro qui sont par contre très jolis.

Et niveau gameplay... Ben c'est du RPG Maker. L'équipement se trouve difficilement, on abuse et surabuse des vivres, les persos de support n'ont pas de heal, les ennemis sont soit trop faciles soit dangeureusement abusés (du style qui te paralysent tout le monde puis t'attaquent jusqu'à ce que mort s'en suive) et quand à la fin d'une zone on arrive à peu près à s'en tirer si bien que les boss sont hyper simples, ben on monte d'un cran et demi la difficulté de la zone suivante histoire de te faire sentir comme une merde et de recommencer des combats qui n'ont aucun intêret sauf de te faire perdre du temps parce que tu prends tellement cher que tu reviens te healer à la case départ.

Si on ajoute à ça les 500 000 altérations d'état, le jeu peut rapidement être décourageant. Avec unne ou deux zones en moins il aurait eu juste la bonne durée de vie pour être ni trop court, ni trop chiant à la longue.

Bref, à prendre en soldes et uniquement si vous avez vraiment la dalle (comme moi maintenant mais y'a une pizza calzone qui arrive)

review:
I think I've put in enough time to get a feel for this game.

Pros:

-Good music for an RPG maker title
-Some of the character design is nice
-Can be pretty difficult, that could go either way, depends on if you like a challenge
-Has Achievements
-Has Trading cards

Cons:

-Right off the bat, I noticed that the controls can't be modified, and the default movement is not the D-pad... why? I feel like precise movements should be the thing here.
-Story is... lackluster, though I only made it to chapter 2, but I didn't feel like it was going anywhere suprising... though I did see a zombie screenshot on the store page. Wish I could have made it to that part. 
-Some of the items and dialog are good, but some of the item labels make no sense. I'm thinking this might be a translation issue. 
-I played on easy mode and got killed a lot in chapter 2, maybe its because I didn't grind enough, maybe I didn't pick the right team, but it feel too difficult to continue.
-Sometimes, squares will be present in the dialog or item descriptions, like a character is missing. Not sure what that's about.
-This game has been out for over a year and these problems still exist, which leads me to belive that they will never be fixed.

Overall, I'd give the game a 5/10. Just barely recommended.

I wouldn't pay full price for it but it'll kill a few hours. It seems deep... if you really fell into it, it'd last you a long time, but it just didn't grip me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009744465', 'num_games_owned': 6422, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1442409968}
review:
Очередная игра сделанная на RPG-maker-е с типичным сюжетом обычного Beat ’em up. Плохие парни похитили вашу подружку, и вы выносите орды врагов, чтобы выяснить кто это сделал и вернуть её. Сюжетка подается через диалоги перед каждой зоной, по окончании оной и парой фраз сказанных в перепалках с боссами уровней. Что делает прохождение игры несколько скучноватым.
В плюсы можно записать довольно оригинальную для подобных игр стилистику игры, возможность первоначального выбора состава команды героев из десятка претендентов, каждый из которых имеет свои наклонности, скилы и оружие, несколько уровней сложности игры, индивидуальный (хоть и не всегда внятный)  тайлсет, неплохую музыкальную составляющую. 
В минусы - излишнюю простоту и слишком сильный упор на задр0тов, сделанный авторами, который вряд ли понравится большинству геймеров.
Сюжетка состоящая из 8 различных зон, именуемых в игре "мирами", проходится где-то за 5-10 часов и игрок получает около 50% всех ачивок на её окончании, но для получения остальных ачивок, бонусных скринов концовки и дополнительных персонажей ту же самую игру с прямым как труба сюжетом и геймплеем придется пройти еще с пять-шесть раз на разных сложностях и без использования лечения, предоставляемого в игре полицией.
В остальном - довольно качественный проект эталонного производителя хороших рпг-шек на RPG-Maker-е Aldorlea Games, отлично проработанный и довольно стабильный.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077147190', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 4647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3522, 'last_played': 1497473440}
review:
Diese Review soll keine Empfehlung sein, sondern Euch ein bisschen über das Spiel informieren. Ich selbst bin eher geteilter Meinung. Am Anfang war es nicht so prickelnd, kann aber meiner Meinung nach auch sehr kurzweilig sein.

Am Anfang wählt man unter seinen Kumpels und Kumpelines drei Charaktere aus, mit denen man dann auf der Suche nach der entführten (zukünftigen) Freundin alles verdrischt, was nicht bei drei auf den Bäumen ist. 
Was die Charaktere dabei für eine Klasse haben, sagt einen das Spiel nicht. Hier kann das Diskussionforum (oder mein Guide;-) weiterhelfen. Die Kämpfe sind bereits ab Schwierigkeitsstufe Normal ziemlich fordernd. Ohne ein ausgewogenes (!) Team bekommt man auf Dauer arge Probleme. Mein John-Ralph-Martin Run war zum Beispiel eine reine Qual.

Das Spiel selbst hat ein paar Macken. Mangels Animationen sieht man nur schwer, wer jetzt wen angreift und was denn jetzt eigentlich grad passiert. Da man nur selten bei Polizisten manuell speichern (ansonsten Autosave alle 5 Kämpfe) und sich heilen kann, sollte man am Ende der Kämpfe immer seine Kämpfer aufpäppeln. Diese haben mit hoher Wahrscheinlichkeit z.B. ein paar Statuseffekte wie Cold, Burned oder Infected  erhalten, die man dann kurieren sollte. 
Ein episches Rollenspiel mit fesselnder Story sollte man nicht erwarten. Hier gehts eher ums Besiegen von Gegnern wie Straßenschlägern, Zombies oder Ninjas, um dann das nächste Storyhäppchen beim Levelboss zu erhalten.
Die Steuerung ist etwas eigen. Man steuert mit den Pfeiltasten. WASD ist nicht möglich. Es ist auch möglich, mit der Maus zu steuern, aber das spielt sich seltsam.

Ich habe das Spiel in ziemlich genau 10 Stunden durchgespielt. Man kann die acht Level von Girlfriend Rescue dabei ganz gut mal häppchenweise für zwischendurch spielen. Und darin liegt auch der Reiz des Spiels: Einfach mal zwischendurch mit seiner "Gang" ein paar Leuten auf die Mütze hauen. Wer solche Spiele mag, kann hier schon 5 € investieren.

review:
There is a lot of fun to be had in Girlfriend Rescue, a game that is more complex than it looks. Beginning with your party selection and continuing with the battle strategies, this is a different type of adventure that will keep you busy for a good while:
- lots of replay via the character selections and difficulty levels.
- artwork is very good.
- lots of things to find as you explore the levels.
- present day story is different, but still a good time.
So give this one a try and you will be drawn in pretty quickly to a unique rpg experience.

review:
Edit:  I am adding/removing things as I'm going through.  As a result, I don't consider this to be a full review.

It's possible that my review will change as I progress further into the game, but so far I'm not impressed.  Before I continue, a little about me.  I've been working with different versions of RPG Maker since the late 90s.  In fact, even now I'm working on an RPG Maker VX title that I will hopefully submit on Steam at some point, though that is easily months away from now.  That said, I have a number of issues with this title.

Almost everything reeks of generic.  The main character is not interesting, nor are any of the side characters.  The dialogue really needs to be entirely redone as it's very amateurish and riddled with multiple grammatical errors that I would overlook if they were attempting to parody other grammatical errors from other games, but clearly they are not.  There are a lot of subtle issues with the game as well.

For starters, barely pressing in one direction in a menu will often cause my cursor to go crazy and skip several lines or just straight up go into hyperdrive.  This has caused me to run from battles where I meant to go into rush instead.  While the graphics are entirely custom, the characters and environments are pretty terrible and low res in general, which makes the game feel that even further cheapened.

I mean, I get it...the sheer number of normal Steam users that complain and drone on about default RTP for RPG Maker more or less forces you to use custom everything and that's fine, but at least make it something halfway appealing and BETTER than the default.  It also doesn't help that certain things went unchecked.  For example, when you stumble upon a merchant, you have the option to deal or not.  If you select not to, it still brings up the shop menu.

These are things that should have been ironed out WAY before release.  As I said, it's possible that I will enjoy it more as time goes on (the opening cutscene was pretty nice for example), but as it stands this comes off more bland and unappealing than I had anticipated.

review:
This RPG game is a nice change up from storming castles and dungeon crawlers.  Takes place in unique settings from planes, to trains, and city streets for example.  The goal is to rescue the girlfriend, after doing that the goal is to rescue whoever else is kidnapped by the bad guys.  Lots of party members to choose from makes each playthrough feel new.  Levels all have unique monsters that fit the level.  There are unlockable characters by beating different modes in different ways.  With the levels just the right size this game is great to speedrun, even better on higher difficulties where the characters move speed becomes super fast!  Great replay value!  

There is no manual for the game that explains ANYTHING in the game or what skills do, or describes any of the stats.  Apparently some of that info is in a separate guide players can buy somewhere online, but even that doesnt include the details of what party members do what people say.  Only way to find a good party is to experiment around and see what works best, or just charge in blindly!   There is also no way to play full screen, hitting alt enter leaves those annoying black bars on every side meaning 30-40% of the screen is just black.  Its un noticable as the heat of battle kicks in though.  WIthout a manual its not a perfect 10 but its so close otherwise from great music to great replay value its a fun RPG to kill time with and change things up from the usual.

Rating:  8/10  Value:  $4.99

review:
Leaves a very bad first impression at least, maybe it gets way better but... I won't be finding out. 

The only "Beat 'Em Up" aspect of the game is that your girlfriend gets kidnapped in Detriot. Other than that it plays out like a mediocre RPG maker game.

The opening dialouge was very stilted and oddly phrased. "I can only take three persons with me." It felt like it was ran from google translate into English.

You get to pick your party at the very beginning, but they never tell you who or what they are. Did I pick a bunch of fighters, or healers, or what? I don't know. There are no descriptions when picking your party, hell they don't even tell you their names.

There are no random encounters which is nice, but I only fought a whopping two battles, none of my party members had any skills and I decided that I have much better games to play than this. If I were hard up for a game to play, maybe I'd give it more of a chance.

I don't have any anti-RPG maker bias, and I've played a few Adolera games before, but this one just seems half-assed from the get-go. I have better things to do...

author: {'steamid': '76561198070835518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1442599181}
review:
[h1]Fast-paced, challenging, with great replay value[/h1]

Choose three gang members and save your girl. Sounds simple? It is - but the value of GR lies in its complexity and variability.
There are [b]multiple levels[/b] - streets,  secret labs, train, etc. Each of these levels feels unique, with different looks, enemies and music themes. For completing a level, you receive a reward in a form of bonus (more damage for certain weapons, better healing and so on). The better the level completition, the better the reward. Once earned [b]bonuses[/b] carry into new games, so it's a good idea to play GR more than once.

The battles are [b]turn-based[/b] and require lot of different strategies. Sometimes the enemies can be paralyzed or poisoned, sometimes brute force is the best solution. Some spells are also placement-based ([i]hit enemies on the left[/i]), so enemies positions matter, too.
Resources are limited, both supplies and enemies, so you can't "over-level" the game. And healing is very costly, plus you don't get the best bonuses if you use it. Depending on bonuses, party and items, you regenerate a bit of health (and "magic") after each successful fight. Similarly as in Dreamscape, it makes the right party composition and strategy  crucial.
Easy difficulty is good for testing the characters and viable parties, because Normal and Hard are simply not doable with "wrong" party. And the harder modes (unlocked by fully completing Hard) are only possible with multiple bonuses. GR is definitively a [b]challenging[/b] game.

The levels are relatively straightforwards - no sidequests, no "turning-back" (i.e. you can't return to a level once you completed it), but there are still many well-hidden items and you usually discover something new in each playthrough. Overall, I enjoyed the complexity of the game. There are just so many party and bonuses combinations. And each of these influences your playing style. And thanks to its fast-pace, it feels pretty addictive. There's certainly the [i]"complete one last level"[/i] feeling to it. And after completing all the levels, it's [i]"do it better and on higher difficulty."[/i]
On top of it, the setting (gangsters, cops, agents, ...) felt pretty refreshing from the usual "Dragons and Elves" thing. GR is a must in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067119595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1582352159}
review:
At first glance, and from it's straightforward name "Girlfriend Rescue" looks to be a fairly easy or casual sort of game ---- but not too long into the very first world you will find that it is full of intricacies, assorted choices, and complex decisions that reveal a great story that is very difficult to take a break from. 
The story told is solid and good fun, the characters are very well developed and likable, and the action/exploration is virtually non-stop. 


As the title reveals, your girlfriend has been kidnapped for unknown nefarious reasons in worn down Detroit, and you and your friends immediately set out to rescue her. A big part of the game is the creation of your party from the available characters since each character has different attributes which will change the way you approach the game ---- so the replay value is very high. (especially if you are wanting to unlock all the achievements.)


The artwork is beautifully done, the music adds a lot to the atmosphere of the game, and the gameplay itself is flawless.


There are a great many items to find and spells to use and learn so you need to explore the game very carefully to find everything. Each world (presented in a maze like style) will tell you how many enemies need to be defeated, and once defeated, they do not reappear. Defeat them all for big bonuses.


So there is great fun to be had here with lots of replay that will keep you busy for many hours. Give this one a try, and you will be drawn into a game that is a bit of a variation on the old style rpg experience that is familiar, and very appealing.
